file_content.text: Shhh. Have the stim? Excellent. Just in time.
We heard about Darth Lachris. Citizens are already rising up in Sobrik. The occupation is ending!
Sir, it's marvelous to see you again. My exile was too long.
Tai... is that you? You look older....
Uh, yes, sir. I've been gone for years. Is he alright?
Darth Lachris was not the gentlest of captors.
He has suffered greatly.
Once he's had time to recover, he'll be back to his old self.
Yes, just shaken.
He's just survived a terrible ordeal. Show some respect.
Don't be so insensitive!
I'm sorry, sir. I wish we had reached you sooner.
I cannot... continue in my position. Tai... I must pass my role on to you.
Good. He can follow a script.
Before I retire from public life, I, President Galthe, hereby... transfer all the powers of my office as president... to Tai Cordan.
As citizens of Balmorra, we bear witness to this decision, made of your own free will.
I accept, sir, and I will strive to be a worthy successor.
Empty... all now. Go. Gone. Nhhh....
Sir? It's Tai, your trade secretary. What's wrong with him?
His mind is irretrievably broken from torture.
Sorry you had to see this.
His time as Darth Lachris's prisoner has left him little more than a shell.
He's been tortured.
Your president couldn't handle a little rough treatment.
He's a vegetable.
No. This can't be. He's... he's our leader.
Imperial atrocities. This is why we must never stop fighting against the Empire.
President Galthe is incapacitated. As senior official, Tai, you inherit his office.
I didn't want it to happen like this.
Tai Cordan, we, as fellow citizens of Balmorra, bear witness to your ascension to the office of president.
I pledge to carry out my duties with honesty, integrity and compassion. For Balmorra.
This will be a difficult time. Set an example for your people. Guide them well.
Be a wise leader.
Well done, President Cordan. The Republic and the Jedi are with you.
Congratulations.
Both Zenith and I made great sacrifices to bring you here.
Remember your debt to us.
I haven't forgotten, Jedi.
As my first act, I've drafted a formal request for Balmorra to join the Republic.
Is there anything you'd like to say on this historic occasion, Master Jedi?
You all stand on the threshold of a new beginning--for Balmorra and for the Republic that waits to embrace you.
The future is yours.
And I hope the Jedi Order will always be a part of that future.
Remember, as Master Dorak once wrote: "The wisest gardener respects the audacity of a stone."
Perhaps a Jedi proverb?
Thank you. I'm sure we all feel... enriched by that.
Make the most of this. I won't always be around to bail you out.
Don't screw this up.
Jedi has a point.
I have a few points of business to finish aboard your ship before I leave, Jedi.
And there's a matter we three need to discuss in private. Zenith, perhaps you should join us there.
Get an adrenal stim from the Republic base. There's not much time.
Tai's gone to meet his citizens' committee. Coming to witness their new president's inauguration, hooray for the resistance.
Darth Lachris got the last laugh. Meet our noble president.
Lonely. Gone, all... who? Nhhh. No more. No. More.
Don't be afraid. I'm a Jedi Master, you're safe with us.
It's alright, friend.
Nhhh. Stars... all 'round. Blind--no, too many....
Maybe he's sick.
Hurt. Shhh--shame. Go. Go 'way.
What?
Nnn... noth--nothing. To say. Ran out.
Imperial torture's shattered him. He can't hand over power. Lachris knew.
No. The Empire can't win. We must fix this.
What exactly are you suggesting?
"Fix this" how?
I know a technique that helps people driven mad by darkness.
I have a shielding ability....
Then try it.
Nnn--no. Can't be. Can't be. Go 'way.
Feared this. He's broken, not corrupted. Hmm.
Let Tai deal with this when he gets back.
This is Tai's problem.
Tai's bringing the citizens. They can't see the president this way.
Corporations donated medical technology. There's a spinal implant, hacks into brain and muscle functions. He'd speak properly, sign his name....
Experimental tech, though. Wouldn't last long and it might kill him. But Tai will be in power, and I doubt the president would want to live like... this.
I don't want Tai to become president because of a trick.
There must be a better way.
Deceit and torture. You're no better than Darth Lachris.
You sound like a Sith.
How dare you. I bled for Balmorra!
If Balmorrans see President Galthe like this, after all we've suffered, they'll crack. Tai's presidency will fail. The end.
If Balmorra wants a great future, it must acknowledge its past.
The people deserve the truth.
Tai escaped Imperial assassination for years. Tai himself proves there's hope.
Tai can help them accept it.
If you're wrong, we lose everything. Hope you can handle that.
Very well. I hope this poor soul is beyond feeling any pain.
Then let's use your plan.
We can't fail now, not when we're so close. Do it.
That's acceptable.
Good. I'll make arrangements.
An adrenal stim will make Galthe look more alert. Get one from the Republic outpost, I'll stall Tai.
Stay quiet. Bad place to be hanging around.
Activity's spiked inside. Security changes, transport arrangements. Guess Darth Lachris is about to move the president.
Can you keep track of him?
Any idea where?
No. We get him now or not at all.
Then let's go.
I'll make sure she fails.
Passwords are all being changed. You'll need me to get to her.
Will return to the ship. Go with caution, Herald.
I never get between a man and his obsession. See you at the ship.
Let's go, Jedi.
We're being cut down out here, Jedi. But--I won't let Darth Lachris win.
We've placed all our concussion charges around the facility. Shockwave will kill everyone inside.
Timer's already counting down. Get everyone out now.
Please tell me those charges are on a long countdown.
How much time do I have?
Longest I could set them for still isn't long. Hurry.
How can you risk all these people for this vendetta of yours?
Are you insane?
Life under Darth Lachris isn't worth living.
I swear, Zenith, if I get out of here, you'll wish I hadn't.
You'll pay for this!
Just get out alive. You can kill me later.
I'll pull out, find the civilians you freed. Get the others and head to this outpost.
If I'm not there, report to Tai--terminal's safe. He needs to know.
We got the Imperial forces to follow us. A few are being stubborn.
They're guarding the facility and civilians inside. Put up defenses. Force fields are blocking the entrance.
I must reach the civilians.
Those people are in danger.
Have your people search for some way to breach those force fields.
Scout for anything useful.
Amateurs search.
Your clumsiness could cost a lot of lives, Zenith.
You tipped them off?
Maybe let me finish.
I have plans with the locations of the generators powering those force fields. Shut those down, the facility's open.
Back to work. Be careful.
I will investigate this director. Might find something useful.
There you are. Building's damp, but safe enough.
Zenith speaking. What do you want?
I'm here on Tai Cordan's behalf.
Tai sent me.
Then what does he want?
I came to help you liberate Balmorra.
I'm a friend and ally.
The Republic says that a lot. Then it leaves.
Watch your tone; I am a Jedi Master and Barsen'thor of the Jedi Order.
I'm a Jedi. Be polite.
Okay. But what do you want?
We share a goal--to free Balmorra's people. Tai Cordan is ready to rebuild the government.
We came to help you.
Tai Cordan requests the use of your followers and information, to help him restore the government.
We need your resources.
I want to run the Imperials off Balmorra so Tai Cordan's new government can take over.
I'm here to fight the Empire.
Unlikely. The old government's in exile; the Empire's too powerful.
Hmm. Tai Cordan was talented. Naive, though. Still, exile can change a person....
No. The Republic has failed us before. Help me first. Then we'll talk.
You appear to have a grudge against the Republic.
Failed you how?
They came to help, then abandoned us. Twice. Prove you're different.
That seems fair.
I'll expect you to hold up your end of the deal.
I'll take that as your word.
Expect what you like.
I'm tracking the Imperial head of manufacture. Responsible for building weapons and enslaving my people. He's operating from inside the Okara Droid Factory.
Normally, no problem. But he has a powerful bodyguard. I can't get close.
Go to the factory and keep the bodyguard out of the way for me. Then we talk politics.
What kind of resistance can I expect?
Tell me about this bodyguard.
I've seen him carry a lightsaber. Be careful.
Count on me.
A menial task.
Don't take long. This mission is vital.
This one is no soft thing. But should respect Scorekeeper's Herald. Now, we go?
Hmph. What a sourpuss.
Not everyone has your gracious disposition, dear Holiday. We'd better do his little chore.
Zenith's got you covered. Meet you back at the ship.
I've been shot at by people with better manners. Guess we'd better go.
Unauthorized access. Initiating lockdown. Please insert security card to proceed.
